review_blob:
Aside from stouts this is my "Ol Standby".  In the realm of major breweries this little ale takes the gold. Not really a " Brown ale" but close enough.Its nuuty flavour and good nose combined with a clean and easy palate. On a hot day its almost medicine. On A side note it makes a great shanty. If your hot a tired pour a newcastle in a large glass and top it off with lemonade. It will recharge you to finnish the day.
Cheers
Hey, Its better than Any of the light beers by far. The taste has Bud beat to hell and back. Stuck in a dive with this and a dozen light berrs its King. Just hold your nose when you drink it

Do any more Shiner drinkers think they changed the recipe? The blonde is seasonal for the brewery. Last year was bad this ones worse. In the begining it tasted like a good cream ale . I mean really nice. Now, Its a malty version of a MGD. Damn it !

Hailsa !
 This is why the Vikings raided monastaries !
Rich brown colour smooth cream head. It sifts in over the tounge like silk. A woody malt flavor is beautiful. Top it off with an alcohol content that will knock the horns of your helmet.
from a 750

this little Porter was alittle lighter in the mouth than I thought in would be. Its got a good dark colour , but a light head that disipates rapidly. A little to much fizz for me in a porter.The bitter nose makes it much better from the bottle than from the pint. overall agreeable with a bit of hard chesse and summer sausage
